title: Health & Body
description: Discuss health issues, body parts, medical vocabulary, and communicate effectively at doctor's appointments.

objectives.description: Name major body parts in Bulgarian

content:
# Health & Body

## Grammar Explanation

### Body Parts (Части на тялото)

**Head & Face**:
- Глава (glava) - head
- Око (oko) - eye
- Ухо (uho) - ear
- Нос (nos) - nose
- Уста (usta) - mouth
- Зъб (zăb) - tooth

**Body**:
- Врат (vrat) - neck
- Рамо (ramo) - shoulder
- Гръб (grăb) - back
- Корем (korem) - stomach/abdomen
- Ръка (răka) - hand/arm
- Крак (krak) - leg/foot

### Health Vocabulary

**Conditions**:
- Здрав/Здрава (zdrav/zdrava) - healthy (m/f)
- Болен/Болна (bolen/bolna) - sick (m/f)
- Болка (bolka) - pain
- Температура (temperatura) - fever
- Настинка (nastinka) - cold
- Грип (grip) - flu

**Medical Terms**:
- Лекар (lekar) - doctor
- Аптека (apteka) - pharmacy
- Лекарство (lekarstvo) - medicine
- Рецепта (retsept) - prescription
- Болница (bolnitsa) - hospital

### Useful Phrases

- **Боли ме...** (Boli me...) - My... hurts
- **Не се чувствам добре** (Ne se chuvstvam dobre) - I don't feel well
- **Имам нужда от лекар** (Imam nuzhda ot lekar) - I need a doctor

## Cultural Notes

1. **Healthcare System**: Bulgaria has both public and private healthcare. EU citizens can use European Health Insurance Card.

2. **Pharmacies**: Bulgarian pharmacists can recommend treatments for minor ailments.

3. **Home Remedies**: Traditional remedies like rakiya (brandy) with honey for colds are common.

4. **Spa Culture**: Mineral springs and spa treatments are popular for health.
